00020 namespace mcGeometry {
00021 /*============================================================================*/
00028 class Sphere : public Quadric {
00029 public:
00030     Sphere(std::vector<double>& C, double R)
00031         : _center(C), _radius(R)
00032     { 
00033         Insist(R > 0, "Sphere must have positive radius.");
00034     }
00035 
00036     Sphere* clone() const { return new Sphere(*this); }
00037 
00038     bool hasPosSense(const std::vector<double>& position) const;
00039 
00040     HitAndDist intersect(const std::vector<double>& position, 
00041             const std::vector<double>& direction, bool posSense) const;
00042 
00043     ~Sphere() { /* * */ };
00044 
00045 protected:
00047     std::ostream& _output( std::ostream& os ) const;
00048 
00049 private:
00050     const std::vector<double> _center;
00051     const double _radius;
00052 };

00054 
00055 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00056 // Equation: (x-x0)^2 + (y-y0)^2 + (z-z0)^2 - R^2 = 0
00057 //      (x,y,z) = center of sphere
00058 //      (x0,y0,z0) = position
00059 inline bool Sphere::hasPosSense(const std::vector<double>& position) const
00060 {
00061     double eval = 0.0;
00062     double temp;
00063 
00064     temp = position[0]-_center[0];
00065     eval += temp*temp;
00066 
00067     temp = position[1]-_center[1];
00068     eval += temp*temp;
00069 
00070     temp = position[2]-_center[2];
00071     eval += temp*temp;
00072 
00073     eval -= _radius*_radius;
00074 
00075     return _hasPosSense(eval);
00076 }
00077 
00078 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00079 inline Quadric::HitAndDist Sphere::intersect(
00080         const std::vector<double>& position, 
00081         const std::vector<double>& direction, bool posSense) const
00082 {
00083     Require(position.size() == 3);
00084     Require(direction.size() == 3);
00085     Require(softEquiv(tranSupport::vectorNorm(direction), 1.0));
00086 
00087     double selfDot = 0.0;
00088     double B = 0.0;
00089     double movedLoc;
00090     
00091     // subtract out the center of the sphere
00092     for (int i = 0; i < 3; ++i) {
00093         movedLoc = (position[i] - _center[i]);
00094         B +=  movedLoc * direction[i]; 
00095         selfDot += movedLoc * movedLoc;
00096     }
00097 
00098     // find distance and whether it intercepts
00099     Quadric::HitAndDist theResult =
00100         _calcQuadraticIntersect(
00101             1,  // A
00102             B,  // B
00103             selfDot - _radius * _radius, //C
00104             posSense);
00105 
00106     return theResult;
00107 
00108     // THIS CODE, SADLY, DOES NOT WORK :
00109 //
00110 //    // Compute relative coordinates
00111 //    std::vector<double> xr(position);
00112 //
00113 //    tranSupport::vectorMinusEq(xr, _center);
00114 //
00115 //    // Compute quadratic coefficients
00116 //    double A = 1.0;
00117 //    double B = tranSupport::vectorDot(direction, xr);
00118 //    double C = _radius*_radius - tranSupport::vectorDot(xr, xr);
00119 //
00120 //    // Call quadratic solver and return result
00121 //    return calcQuadraticIntersect(A, B, C, posSense);
00122 //    
00123 }

00127 inline std::ostream& Sphere::_output( std::ostream& os ) const {
00128     os  << "[ SPHERE Center: " << std::setw(10) << _center
00129         << " Radius: " << std::setw(5) << _radius
00130         << " ]";
00131     return os;
00132 }
